title: The One With The Ick Factor

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Tell him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Tell him, tell him.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Just...please tell him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Shut up!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Tell me what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look at you, you won't even look at him.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) Oh, come on tell me. I could use another reason why women won't look at me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, all right, all right. Last night, I had a dream that, uh, you and I, were...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Doing it on this table. (points at the table)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Exellent dream score.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why, why, why would you dream that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: More importantly, was I any good?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you were pretty damn good.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Interesting, cause in my dreams, I'm allways surprisingly inadequate. (Monica pats him on his lap)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, last night you seemed to know your way around the table.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I love it, when we share.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're okay there?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I can't belive you two had sex in her dream.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, it was a one-time-thing. I was very drunk and i was somebody else's subconscious.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Chandler is sitting on the table.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Get off.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (points at Joey's pen) Uh, uh, gimme. Can you see me operating a drill press?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know. What are you wearing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, why would you want to operate a drill press?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Just for some short-term-work. You know, until I get back some of my massage clients.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Pirates again?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, nothing like that. I was just...such a dummie. I taught this "massage-yourself-at-home-workshop." And they are.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, Chan. She could work for you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcasticly) Thanks Joey, that's a good idea.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What... I could, I could do it. What is it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, my secretary is gonna be out for a couple of weeks. She is having one of her boobs redused. (Ross looks at her.) It's a whole big boob story.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I could be a secretary.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you know Phoebs. I don't know if it's your kinda thing, because it involves a lot of being normal. For a large portion of the day.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I could do that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you playing with?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, it's my new beeper.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What the hell does a paleontologist need a beeper for?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is it like for dinosaur emergencies. 'Help, come quick, they're still extinct.'

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it's for when Carol goes into labor. She can get me wherever I am. I mean, all she has to do is to dial 55-JIMBO.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: A cool phone number, and a possible name for the kid.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, I'll see you guys later. (raises)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Off to see young Ethan?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How young is young Ethan? Young?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He's... our age.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: When we were?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, he's a senior in college.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: College?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoa! And this manchild has no problem with how old you are?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, of course not. It's not even an issue. Cause I told him I was 22.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I can't pass for 22?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, maybe 25-26.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I am 26.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: There you go.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's office, he and Phoebe are there when the phone starts ringing.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (plays with a thumbtack remover) Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: See that'll stop when you pick up the phone.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh. Uh, I'm on. (picks up the phone)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (with a deep voice) Mr. Bing's office. (Listens) No I'm sorry, he's in a meeting right now.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not in a meeting. I'm right... Whoops.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Will he know what this is in reference to? (Listens) And he has your number? (Listens) All right, I'll see that he gets the message. Bye bye.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ross says hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is so fun. All right, what do we do now?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, now, I actually have to get to work.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Most likely. (raises and goes toward the door) Okay, I'm gonna be out there.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. Bye bye.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bye bye.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (answering it) Yes?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whatcha doin'?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh. (leans against the desk)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there. Monica is just finishing
cleaning the windows.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Windows are clean, candels are lit. Uh, belt's to tight, gotta change the belt. Did I turn the fish? (goes over to the kitchen to check on the dinner) No, cause I made lasagne. (to Rachel) Am I out of control?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just a touch. Mon, I don't understand. I mean, you've been dating this guy since like, what... his midterms? I mean, why all the sudden are you so... Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Could tonight be the Night?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know. Look he's a great guy and I love being with him but... you know. Things happen, and they happen. You don't plan these things.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, did you shave your legs?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: A-ha!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk. Joey and Ross are there.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Would you let it go Ross. It was just a dream. It doesn't mean...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, oh. Oh, oh. Oh this is it. Oh my god it's baby time. Baby time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, relax, relax. Just relax, just relax. Be cool, be cool.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, hi, I was just beeped. (pause) No, André is not here. (to Joey) Third time today. (on phone) Yes, I'm sure... No, sir. I don't perform those kind of services.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Services? (Ross looks at him) Oh, services.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, you want 55-JUMBO. Yeah, that's right. That's right, JUMBO with a U, sir. (pause) No, belive me, you don't want me. Judging by his number, I'd be a huge disappointment. (pause) All rightie, bye bye.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, hey. How was the first day?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, exellent. Everyone was so, so nice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: See, it pays to know the man who wears my shoes. (Joey and Ross wonder what he means) Me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I didn't tell anybody that I knew you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, because, you know... they don't like you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I thought you knew that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Noho. Who doesn't they like me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Everyone. Except for uh... no everyone.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Don't feel bad. You know they used to like you a lot. But then you got promoted, and, you know, now you're like "Mr. Boss Man". You know, Mr. Bing. Mr. Bing, "Boss Man Bing".

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't belive it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. They even do you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: They do me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know like... uh okay... uh... 'Could that report be any later?'

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't sound like that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, oh Chandler...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh... Yeah, you do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'The hills were alive with the sound of music.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (reaches for hi scones) My scones.

dialogue.speaker: AND ROSS
dialogue.text: ' My scones.'

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, I don't sound like that. That is so not true.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That is so not ... That is so not ... That... Oh, shut up!

scenes.location: Central Perk. Joey and Ross are there.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Young Ethan are sitting in the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did not.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: I am telling you, up until I was, like nine, I thought that gunpoint was an actual place where crimes happen.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How was that possible?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Well, think about it. It's always on the news. 'A man is being held up, at gunpoint.' 'Tourists are being terrorised, at gunp

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Unless...

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, ah. Unless you wanna stay over? I mean, I'm going to, so...

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'd really like that.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Uuh, before we get into any staying-over-stuff, there is something you should know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, is this like 'I have an early class tomorrow' or 'I'm secretly married to a goat?'

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Well it's somewhere in between. You see, in a strictly technical sense, of course, I'm not uh..., well I, I mean I haven't ever uh...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ethan?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you a virgin?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Well, if that's what you kids are calling it these days then, yes I am. I uh, I've kinda been waiting for the right person.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Yeah. You do know I was talking about you, right?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You keep saying that.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: You know, you read about it, you see it in the movies. Even when you practice it at home, man oh man, it is nothing like that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Listen, uh, you told me something that was really difficult for you. And I, I-I figured if you could be honest, then I can to.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Oh god, don't tell me, I did it wrong.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No-no. Nothing wrong about that.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Um, okay, here it goes. I'm not 22. I'm, I'm 25... and thirteen months.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Huh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: But I figured, you know, that shouldn't change anything. I mean, what the hell does it matter how old we are.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Uh, listen um, as long as we're telling stuff, uh, I have another one for you. I'm a little younger than I said.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're not a senior?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm a senior... in High School.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok...ay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What we did was wrong. Oh god, I just had sex with somebody that wasn't alive during the Bicentennial.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: I just had sex.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ethan, focus. How could you not tell me?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Well, you never told me how old you were.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, that's different. My lie didn't make one of us a felon in 48 states. What were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: I wasn't thinking. I was too busy fallin'...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Don't say it. (closes Ethan's mouth with her hand)

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: ...in love with you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: (nods) Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well,fall out of it. You know, you shouldn't even be here, it's a school night. Oh god, oh god. I'm like those women that you see with shiny guys named Chad. I'm Joan Collins.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Who?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone exept Monica is there.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Okay, André should be there in like 45 minutes. All rightie, bye bye. (to Phoebe) Just easier that way.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, come on. You told me about the last dream.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, forget it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, why not. Was I doing anything particularly... saucy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, fine. Um, you were not the only one there. (Camera fades to Ross, who's listening very carefully) Joey was there too.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right. (Moves closer.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Was there...uh, huh, huh, huh... andybody, anybody else there.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're sure? Nobody uh, handed out uh, mints or anything?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, it was just the three of us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So, tell me. Was it like you and Chandler, and then you and me, or you and me and Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (laughs) You know what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: There were times when it wasn't even me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That is so sweet, you guys. (hugs them)

dialogue.speaker: AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, Mon.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon, Ethan called again. Mon?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: (shouting) Mon!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ethan called again.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you not seeing him anymore?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No. You know, sometimes just things doesn't work out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And this has nothing to do with the fact that he needs a note to get out of gym.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I, I didn't say any... I sw... I did not say anything, I swear. He stopped by.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, the next time you talk to him, can you ask him which one the strongest Power Ranger is?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ha,ha, ha, oh my life is just so amusing. Could we drop it now?

dialogue.speaker: AND ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's morphin time!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Stegosaurus!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Tyrannosaurus!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, oh, I've gotta go. (raises) Whoa, oh, head rush. One more, and then I have to go. (sits down, and then raises again) Cool!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Where are you going?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, oh, I've got a birthday party, with some work people.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Work people? Nobody told me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I know. That's a part of the whole, you know, them-not-liking-you-extravaganza.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, I don't get this. A month ago, these people were my friends. You know, just because I'm in charge doesn't mean I'm a different person.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, then you should come tonight. You know, just hang out with them. Let them see what a great guy you still are.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You think I should?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I really do, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, but, could we not go together? I,I don't wanna be the geek that invited the boss.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's office, he and Phoebe are taking a break from work.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I Think last night was great. You know, the Karaoke thing. Tracy and I doing Ebony and Ivory .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You were great. But they still made fun of you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, now you're more like, you know like, "Mr. Caring Boss," "Mr.", you know, "I'm one of you, Boss," "Mr., I wanna be your buddy, Boss Man Bing!"

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then, I don't get it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, you know what Chandler? I think you've gotta face it. You're like, the guy in the big office, you know. You're the one that hires them, that fires them... They still say you're a great boss.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: They do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh huh. But they're not your friends anymore.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I just wan't to...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, but you can't.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: But I just wa...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh uh.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk. Everyone exept Phoebe and Chandler is there. Ross's beeper goes
off and everyone exept him react.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aren't you gonna...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, Carol and I have a new system. If she punches in 911, it means she's having a baby, otherwise I just ignore it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What about André?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, well this morning he got a call from who I think was our cousin Nathan, and frankly, it was a little more than I needed to know.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That was gonna be my opener.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (understands that Monica and Ethan wanna be alone) Hey, did you guys check out those new hand-dryers in the bathroom?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I thought that was just a rumour.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: True story.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They're here already?

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: All right, look. I've gotta tell you something. I'm not 17. I only said so that you'd think I was cute and vunerable. I'm actually 30, I have a wife, I have a job, I'm your Congressman. Monica, this is ridiculous, we're great together. We can talk, we make each other laugh, and the sex. Oh, man, okay i have no frame of graft, but I thought that was great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It was.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Then, what's the problem?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ethan, it's um... it's icky.

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: Icky? You're actually gonna throw this away because it's icky?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This isn't easy for me either. I wish things were different, I... If you were a few years older, or if I was a few years younger, or if we lived in biblical times, I would really...

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ETHAN
dialogue.text: No, don't say it. (closes Monica's mouth with his hand)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...love you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you're hands still wet?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, moist, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Let's dry 'em again.

scenes.location:
Central Perk. Everyone exept Phoebe and Chandler is there. Ross's beeper goes
off and everyone exept him react.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A hall on the floor where Chandler works. Chandler and Phoebe enters, and
overhears some employees's conversation. One of them is doing Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: GERSTON
dialogue.text: Uh, like, could these margaritas be any stronger? (They discover that Chandler is listening) Hey, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: SANTOS
dialogue.text: Hello, Mr. Bing.

dialogue.speaker: PETRIE
dialogue.text: Loved your Stevie Wonder last night.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks. Listen, about the weekly numbers, I'm gonna need them on my desk by nine o'clock.

dialogue.speaker: SANTOS
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: GERSTON
dialogue.text: No problem.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You have to give 'em something, you know. Okay, now that was Gerston, Santos, and who's the guy with the moustache?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Petrie.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Petrie, right, right. Okay, some people gonna be working this weekend.

scenes.location: A hall on the floor where Chandler works. Chandler and Phoebe enters

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is watching TV, but turns it off, and Rachel is
sleeping on the couch. Ross puts a blanket over her.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (talking in her sleep) Oooooooooh. (Rachel strokes her hand over the pillow. Ross mimicks her silently) Oh, that's nice. Oh, oh. Huh, Ross!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You are. Well, um... We, we, we were just... Wow!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? (his beeper goes off) Great, now I'm having a baby.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ooh, Ooh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm having... I'm having a baby. (jumps back onto the table again) I'm having a... Where's the phone? The phone?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know where the phone is.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm hurt.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hallway, Ross is eagerly waiting for the others to get ready, to go to the
hospital.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica, let's go. Come on now people, woman in labor.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (doing a little dance) Hey Ross, look what I've got going here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, save it for the cab, okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you doing? We're going to a hospital.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, so I can't lokk nice? There might be doctors there.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey, get out of the fridge.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, all right. (he comes out from their apartment with a huge sandwich in his hand)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What is that? (refering to the sandwich)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: For the ride.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, like in a cab...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Save it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, hating this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica, come on now. Let's go, baby coming.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can't belive it, I'm gonna be an aunt. I'm gonna have like a nephew.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's nice. Get out Let's go, come on.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, I'm going. I'm going.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here we go, here we go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Rossy, Rossy.
